text: you never know what you're going to do
to inspire someone and so sometimes you
have these intentional acts and they
aren't inspirational and sometimes
accidental acts are and so anytime we
can present a human being a view of
their world in a slightly different way
that may make their brain kind of
rethink what's going on I think that
that's a little spark of imagination a
little spark of motivation I definitely
wanted to try the social media thing I
didn't know if it would be big or not
and what I really wanted to try to do
was put that life on the space station
put into motion a little bit and so
there was some great new social media
tools that came out right before I
launched that kind of allowed us to do
that and so my crew and I thought that
putting science and motion putting the
view out the window in motion that that
would be a big hit and that was the
catalyst that started this and then and
it exploded it was just fantastic and
the feedback was great and I actually
became kind of addicted to this social
media to bringing people along with me
it's a very unique place it was a very
neat place and I wanted to share it and
and as more and more people got involved
it actually motivated meeting now we
were into photos and what's the earth
look like and what's it feel like and to
be able to do that from the space
station and to be able to do it so
easily to inject that right into
someone's phone or their computer at
home I think that's that's really great
